Verse: A man named Nebuchadnezzar was the king of Babylon. Another man named Jehoiakim was the king of Judah. [When Jehoiakim had been the king of Judah for about three years] Nebuchadnezzar and Nebuchadnezzar's army went to Jerusalem. Then Nebuchadnezzar and Nebuchadnezzar's army attacked Jerusalem. Nebuchadnezzar and Nebuchadnezzar's army defeated Jehoiakim and Jehoiakim's army.

Verse: God allowed [Nebuchadnezzar to capture Jehoiakim and many Jews]. God also allowed [Nebuchadnezzar to take some holy things from the temple [that was in Jerusalem]]. Nebuchadnezzar took many Jews and these holy things to Babylon. Then Nebuchadnezzar put the holy things in the temple of Nebuchadnezzar's god.

Verse: Nebuchadnezzar wanted [Ashpenaz to bring men [who were healthy and handsome]]. KJV: The princes, rulers, captains and the king’s officials came to look. They saw that the fire had not hurt Shadrach, Meshach and Abednego. The fire had not damaged their hair or their clothes. There was not even the smell of smoke.

Verse: Then Nebuchadnezzar said, ["Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego honor the true God]. All people must honor the God of Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego. God sent an angel [in order to save these men [that serve God]]. These men trusted God. And these men did not do all the things [that I(king) said]. These men were willing [to die] [in order to honor the God of these men]. These men do not honor other gods.

KJV: Nebuchadnezzar said, ‘Give honour to the God of Shadrach, Meshach and Abednego. He sent his angel to rescue his servants. They trusted God and did not obey the king. They risked their lives so that they could give honour to their own God and not any other god.

Verse: So I(Nebuchadnezzar) order [all people to do all the things [that my(Nebuchadnezzar's) new command says]]. People must not say bad things about the God of Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego. My(Nebuchadnezzar's) servants will kill all people [who do not do all the things [that this command says]]. My(Nebuchadnezzar's) servants will also destroy the houses of the people [who do not do all the things [that this command says]]. No god is able [to save people [like God saves people]]."

KJV: At the end of that time, I, Nebuchadnezzar, looked up towards heaven. I got my proper mind back. I thanked the true God. I gave honour to him who never dies. His kingdom will never end. He rules all the time.

Verse: All the people [who live on the earth] are worthless. God rules the angels [who are in heaven]. And God rules the people [who live on the earth]. No man is more powerful than God. No man is able [to ask God questions]. No man says to God, ["Why are you(God) doing these things]?"

KJV: All the people of the earth are worth nothing. He does what he wants with the angels in heaven. He does what he wants with the people who live on the earth. Nobody can stop him. Nobody can ask him, ‘What are you doing?’

Verse: [After I(Nebuchadnezzar) was able [to think correctly] again] I(Nebuchadnezzar) ruled the earth again. Officials and important men looked for me(Nebuchadnezzar). [After the officials found me(Nebuchadnezzar)] I(Nebuchadnezzar) became the king again. People respected me(Nebuchadnezzar) again. And I(Nebuchadnezzar) became a very great king.

KJV: You think that you are more important than the God of heaven. You demanded the cups from his house. And you, your wives, your other women and your important people drank wine from them. Then you gave honour to gods that people had made from silver, gold, bronze, iron, wood and stone. These gods cannot see or hear. And they cannot understand. But you gave honour to them and you did not give honour to the true God. He controls your breath. He has power over everything you do.

KJV: Then Daniel’s enemies came together. They saw that Daniel was praying and he was asking God for help.

Verse: So the officials went to the king. The officials spoke to the king about the law [that the king had written the king's name on]. The officials said to the king, ["Do you(king) remember [that you(king) wrote your(king's) name on a new law]]? The law orders [every man to pray only to you(king) for 30 days]. No man may pray to a god or to another man. [If a man prays to a god or to another man] your(king's) servants must throw that man into the pit [that you(king) keep lions in]." The king answered the officials, ["Yes]. I(king) remember the law. All of the people [who live in Media and in Persia] must do all the things [that this law says]."

KJV: So they went to the king. They spoke to him about the law that he had made. ‘Do you remember that you signed a law? For 30 days, nobody must pray to any god or man, except to you, the king. If they do, your servants must throw them into a hole where you keep lions.’ The king answered, ‘It is true. It is a law of the Medes and Persians that nobody can change.’

Verse: Then the officials said to the king, ["Daniel [who is one of the people [that came from Judah]] does not do all the things [that you(king) say]]. Daniel does not do all the things [that the law [that you(king) wrote your(king's) name on] says]. Daniel prays to God three times every day."

KJV: The king gave an order to his servants. The servants brought the men who had accused Daniel. They threw those men and their wives and children into the hole with the lions. Before they reached the bottom of the hole, the lions attacked them. The lions broke all their bones. The king then punished Daniel’s enemies. He punished their families too. That was the law of the Medes and Persians. The king’s servants threw the evil men and their families to the lions. The lions killed them before they reached the bottom of the hole. This shows that the lions were hungry. Although the lions were hungry, they had not hurt Daniel. God really had saved him. The wives and children were probably innocent. But they died too because Daniel’s enemies did an evil thing.

KJV: ‘God has chosen a period of 70 times 7 years’, Gabriel continued. ‘This is about your people and the holy city. God will stop evil and bad things. He will forgive the wrong things that people have done. He will bring good that will last always. What the prophets wrote about will happen. He will establish the very holy place.’

Verse: I(Gabriel) want [you(Daniel) to understand these things]. A king will command [people to build Jerusalem again]. Then God will cause [a special ruler to come]. The special ruler's name is Anointed-One. There will be 49 years. Then there will be 434 years. People will build Jerusalem again. Those people will build streets and a wall. But God's people will suffer during that time.

KJV: ‘I want you to know and understand’, Gabriel continued. ‘Someone will issue a command to build Jerusalem again. Later, God will appoint a special ruler to come. There will be 7 times 7 years. Then there will be 62 times 7 years. People will build the city of Jerusalem again. They will build streets and a wall. But God’s people will suffer trouble during this time.

Verse: Then a person will kill the Anointed-One. The Anointed-One will not have a city. Then a prince and the prince's army will come to the city suddenly. And the prince's army will destroy the city and the temple. God has ordered [people to destroy those things]. And there will be war until the end of that time.

KJV: After this time, someone will kill the ruler whom God has appointed. The ruler will not have a city. A prince will come with his army and destroy the city and the holy place. The end will be like a flood. God has ordered people to destroy things and there will be war until the end of that time.

Verse: The prince will make a covenant with many people for 7 years. But the prince will command [people to stop giving sacrifices to God] after three and a half years. Then the prince will put a terrible thing in the temple. That terrible thing will stay in the temple [until God destroys that terrible thing]. God has already decided [to do certain things] [when the world ends]."
